extracted_playbook.title: Identify MSMQ Installation
extracted_playbook.description: Check if MSMQ is installed on the system as it is an optional Windows component.

extracted_playbook.title: Apply April 2023 Security Updates
extracted_playbook.description: Install the latest patches for Microsoft Windows operating systems to address the vulnerability.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable MSMQ
extracted_playbook.description: Prevent exploitation by disabling MSMQ through the Control Panel.

extracted_playbook.title: Block Inbound Connections on Port 1801/tcp
extracted_playbook.description: Block inbound connections for port 1801/tcp from untrusted sources to prevent exploitation attempts.

extracted_playbook.title: Review Network Connections for MSMQ
extracted_playbook.description: Detect potential exploitation attempts by reviewing network connections on endpoints where MSMQ service is running (port 1801/tcp) from unexpected sources.

extracted_playbook.title: Review Child Processes of mqsvc.exe
extracted_playbook.description: Check for suspicious events by reviewing potential child processes of mqsvc.exe, such as mqsvc.exe executing cmd.exe or powershell.exe.

affected_products: All Windows operating systems including Windows Server 2022 and Windows 11
